snippet: A ruling by federal appeals judges involving the studio Fox Searchlight Pictures could have broad ramifications for the way employers rely on unpaid work.
abstract: Federal appeals court vacates ruling in case brought against Fox Searchlight Pictures by unpaid interns; finds that employers have considerable leeway in their use of unpaid interns when work serves educational purpose; ruling sets high bar for new class-action lawsuits brought by interns and could have broad ramification for way employers rely on unpaid labor.
lead_paragraph: A ruling by federal appeals judges involving the studio Fox Searchlight Pictures could have broad ramifications for the way employers rely on unpaid work.

headline.main: Employers Have Greater Leeway on Unpaid Internships, Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Ruling on Unpaid Interns May Raise Bar for Claims
